sources.description: The Christianization of Hawaii at the beginning of the 19th century by New England Calvinists, portrayed through the fate of a zealous seeker of God who, in his blind fanaticism and excessive moral strictness, proclaims a threatening message instead of the good news.. A sprawling (partial) film adaptation of Michener's novel, staged with great technical effort as a perfect cinematic, but without any in-depth exploration of the issues..

metadata.Plot: Reverend Abner Hale (Max Von Sydow), a rigid and humorless New England missionary, marries the beautiful Jerusha Bromley (Dame Julie Andrews) and takes her to the exotic island kingdom of Hawaii, intent on converting the natives. But the clash between the two cultures is too great and instead of understanding, there comes tragedy.
metadata.Writer: James A. Michener, Dalton Trumbo, Daniel Taradash
metadata.Actors: Julie Andrews, Max von Sydow, Richard Harris
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. 2 wins & 10 nominations total
